block.p: Mary Ellen Romary, the daughter of Darlene and O. Jules Romary of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., was married yesterday at the Boathouse in Central Park to Samuel N. Wender, the son of Dorothy and Norman Wender of Tamarac, Fla. Rabbi Charles D. Lippman performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Louis L. Gioia, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Wender, 31, is an advertising account manager for BabyTalk and Healthy Pregnancy magazines in New York. She graduated from Denison University. Her father retired as the vice president and secretary of the Union Carbide Corporation in Danbury, Conn.

Mary Ellen Romary, the daughter of Darlene and O. Jules Romary of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., was married yesterday at the Boathouse in Central Park to Samuel N. Wender, the son of Dorothy and Norman Wender of Tamarac, Fla. Rabbi Charles D. Lippman performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Louis L. Gioia, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Wender, 31, is an advertising account manager for BabyTalk and Healthy Pregnancy magazines in New York. She graduated from Denison University. Her father retired as the vice president and secretary of the Union Carbide Corporation in Danbury, Conn.

Mr. Wender, 41, is the associate publisher of Crain's New York Business. He graduated from the State University College at Oneonta, N.Y. His mother retired as the customer service director of the East River Savings Bank branch in Larchmont, N.Y. His father retired as the office manager at Sell-Mor, a hardware and lumber business in New Rochelle, N.Y. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
